page.title: 17ECOLOGY - Bird Life
page.content: One of the best places for watching birds is from the back lane which runs from Brierton quarry to Dalton Piercy. The most common birds to be seen are the crow, rook, blackbird, songthrush and magpie. Slightly less common but also seen are the skylark, partridge, pheasant, blue tit and kestrel. The kestrel is being seen more and more frequently near the A19 where it finds easy carrion. Farmers recognise it as an ally against mice, rats, voles and harmful insects which destroy their crops. Occasionally a sparrow hawk may be seen, and there are doves and swallows near Brierton Farms. Most interesting of all perhaps are the owls. Several species of owl can be seen but the most common is the barn owl.
